page.title: 03FARM LIFE AT BRUNTSHIELDS
page.content: Bruntshields Farm is mainly a dairy farm. It has been in the Shuttleworth family for thirty three years. It is rented from Colonel Charteris and covers two hundred acres. The farm consists of one hundred and five dairy cattle (Fresian), fifty Fresian dairy followers (these are calves which will become dairy cattle) and seventy beef cattle. These are a mixture of Angus and Limousin cross Fresians. The milk tanker comes daily and collects, on average, 1400 litres of milk. For feeding, the cattle have grass during the summer and silage (home produced) plus cake and concentrates in the winter. Bruntshields also has sheep - one hundred and twenty ewes, one hundred and eighty lambs and three tips. (cont.)
